Mission 11: Argumentative Writing

Write Arguments with Clear Reasons and Evidence

[SYSTEM NOTIFICATION]
A Literary Gate has been detected. Difficulty: B-Rank.
Hunter Hyro, learn to persuade with powerful arguments backed by solid evidence!

The Challenge Awaits

Argumentative writing takes a clear position and supports it with evidence and reasoning. Like convincing your guild to try a new strategy, you must present your case logically and address opposing views.

Your mission? Write an argumentative essay with a clear claim supported by relevant evidence and strong reasoning.

Hunter Equipment

  • Pencil or computer for writing
  • Argument planning template
  • Evidence sources

Skills to Unlock

Power Standard PS11
The student will write arguments with clear reasons and relevant evidence.

Training Scrolls

Argument Structure:

  • Claim: Your main argument or position
  • Reasons: Why your claim is correct
  • Evidence: Facts, statistics, examples that prove your reasons
  • Counterclaim: The opposing view
  • Rebuttal: Why the counterclaim is wrong or weaker

Dungeon Raid

Official Quest Instructions

Students will complete the Argument Writing worksheet, demonstrating their ability to construct a persuasive argument with claims, evidence, and reasoning.

Your Quest Materials

Argument Writing - Complete this worksheet

Raid Strategy Guide

Step 1: Take a Clear Position

Choose a side on the issue. Your claim should be specific and debatable (people could disagree with it).

Step 2: Gather Evidence

Find facts, statistics, expert opinions, or examples that support your claim. The stronger your evidence, the stronger your argument.

Step 3: Explain Your Reasoning

Don't just present evidence - explain HOW it supports your claim. Connect the dots for your reader.

Step 4: Address the Opposition

Acknowledge what the other side might say, then explain why your position is still stronger.

Step 5: Write a Strong Conclusion

Restate your claim and summarize your strongest points. End with a call to action or thought-provoking statement.

Guild Master Verification

STOP! Summon your Guild Master (Parent/Guardian) for verification.

  • [ ] Claim is clear and debatable
  • [ ] Multiple pieces of evidence support the claim
  • [ ] Reasoning explains how evidence supports claim
  • [ ] Counterclaim is addressed
  • [ ] Worksheet is complete
